<a href="style=%22border-bottom:none!important;%22" target="_blank"></a>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>A few fun notes from the world of hockey to kick off your week…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Today is the 40th anniversary of USA hockey winning the gold medal at the 1980 Olympics in Lake Placid. People forget that the team still had to play another game after the “Miracle on Ice” vs. the USSR.  </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>On Saturday, Alex Ovechkin became the eighth player in NHL history to score 700 career goals.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Also on Saturday, 42-year-old Zamboni driver David Ayres was called into action as the emergency goalie for the Carolina Hurricanes. He stopped eight out of 10 shots, earning the win and a $500 paycheck.</span></li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/23/buffetts-annual-shareholder-letter-reveals-frustrations?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Buffett’s Letter Shows We All Have Those Days
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A photo of Warren Buffett" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyNDgwNTMwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>"<a href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/140989741@N04/25812934256/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Warren Buffett</a>" (<a href="https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Public Domain</a>) by <a href="https://www.flickr.com/people/140989741@N04/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">freeimage4life</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Warren Buffett’s annual shareholder letters are known for their “folksy” wisdom and one-liners. But <a href="https://www.berkshirehathaway.com/letters/2019ltr.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the one</a> he released Saturday was more <em>Nightly News</em> than <em>The </em><em>Daily Show</em>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Maybe that’s because there isn’t much for Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway to smile about. The sprawling conglomerate’s operating income dipped to $4.4 billion in Q4, a <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-berkshire-results/rising-stocks-fuel-record-profit-for-buffetts-berkshire-operating-profit-disappoints-idUSKCN20G0JE?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">23% drop</a> from a year ago. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>That number does </span><span><em>not </em></span><span>take into account Berkshire’s investments in stocks, but Buffett has said it’s a better measure of his company’s performance.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Berkshire Hathaway partially or wholly owns companies across many industries, from Geico in insurance to BNSF Railway. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Those holdings have been lucrative for the company, but now it has $128 billion in cash and can’t seem to find an effective way to spend it. “The opportunities to make major acquisitions possessing our required attributes are rare,” Buffett wrote. So instead he spent a record $2.2 billion on stock buybacks during the quarter.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Overall, Berkshire’s stock gained 11% in 2019, while the S&P returned 31.5%, including dividends. It’s Berkshire’s worst <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/berkshire-hathaway-posts-29-2-billion-in-quarterly-earnings-11582379630?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stock market underperformance</a> in 10 years.   </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Fine, there were some good quotes</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">On mergers: </strong>“I’ve concluded that acquisitions are similar to marriage...sometimes, wonderfully, the new union delivers bliss beyond either party’s hopes. In other cases, disillusionment is swift.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">On sticking to things you’re good at: </strong>“If I were ever scheduled to appear on <em>Dancing With the Stars</em>, I would immediately seek refuge in the Witness Protection Program. We are all duds at one thing or another.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">On succession: </strong>“Berkshire shareholders need not worry: Your company is 100% prepared for our departure,” Buffett wrote about himself and his 96-year-old deputy Charlie Munger. Buffett, 89, plans to give <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-22/buffett-nods-to-succession-by-giving-jain-abel-a-bigger-voice?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more face time</a> to Ajit Jain and Greg Abel, the two lieutenants most likely to succeed him at the top of Berkshire. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/23/venice-cancels-carnival-drugs-face-shortages-coronavirus-outbreak-worsens?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Carnival Masks Don’t Protect Against Coronavirus
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Performers at Venice's Carnival " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyNDc5NTc2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pixabay</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It might be time to make 2020 the year of WFH. As of yesterday, there were almost 79,000 confirmed coronavirus cases and nearly 2,500 deaths. As infection rates spike in countries like Italy and South Korea, businesses are bracing for deeper impacts.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tourism: </strong>Italy <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/02/23/europe/italy-novel-coronavirus-spike-intl/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shut down public events</a> in 10 cities as its caseload spiked above 130 Sunday morning—the largest outbreak outside Asia. Authorities even canceled Venice's popular Carnival festivities.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>France is experiencing a 30%–40% </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/23/coronavirus-impact-france-sees-tourism-numbers-fall-by-30percent-to-40percent.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">drop in tourists</a></span><span> since the outbreak, its finance minister said. Almost 8% of its GDP comes from tourism, and around 2.7 million Chinese tourists visit annually. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Pharma: </strong>China is a major supplier of ingredients for medicines. If the outbreak worsens and production levels don’t return to normal, ~150 prescription drugs <a href="https://www.axios.com/coronavirus-threatens-drug-shortage-318c9e7b-5d92-4a5e-b992-2478023c6d01.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">could face shortages</a>, Axios reports.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Transportation: </strong>Airlines have <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/21/coronavirus-flight-cancellations-top-200000-sending-jet-fuel-lower.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pulled 200,000+ flights</a>. The disruptions will likely cause the first dip in global air travel demand since 2009. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One subset of aviation is doing just fine, though. The number of business jet flights between Hong Kong to Australia and North America <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/7f22ce92-54c6-11ea-90ad-25e377c0ee1f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surged 214% in January</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRADE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/23/india-pm-modi-hosts-namaste-trump-rally?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Modi Says “Namaste Trump”
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="President Trump and Indian Prime Minister Modi " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyNDc1MDA2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>SAUL LOEB/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tired:</strong> Wooing with chocolate and flowers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wired:</strong> Plastering the city of <span>Ahmedabad </span>with nearly $14 million in ads featuring the two of you. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, Indian PM Narendra Modi <a href="https://apnews.com/aa3d9fad64b1127b730566830e302be0?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is hosting President Trump</a> for “Namaste Trump,” a titanic-sized rally that will showcase their chummy relationship. Trump said Modi told him 10 million people would show up along the route to the event venue. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>For Modi, the rally flexes his status on the world stage and distracts from ongoing controversies (like a new citizenship law). For Trump, it’s part of a </span><span><a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/02/23/trump-modi-india-rally-116463?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pitch to Indian-American voters</a></span><span>, 80%+ of which voted for Hillary Clinton in 2016. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>India might’ve edged out the U.K. as the world’s fifth-largest economy last year, but it’s facing its worst slowdown in a decade. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At the same time, it’s stuck in an 18-month trade rut with the U.S. Trump and Modi have <a href="https://apnews.com/cda7fb4ebba1432ba824d2dfbd41fc17?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">moved</a> their respective countries to more protectionist policies, complicating negotiations, but Trump is keen on opening up India’s vast consumer market (pop. 1.3 billion) to American dairy, whiskey, and pharmaceutical companies. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Trump said he’s saving a "big deal" for later, potentially after the election.</p>

</h3>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We used to miss flights. Not in that we’d fail to actually <em>catch</em> a flight, we just missed them in the sense we never had a good enough <a href="https://www.wisebread.com/compare/sapphire-travel?utm_medium=native&utm_source=newsletter&utm_term=morningbrew&adgroup=0224&utm_campaign=CSP-31&utm_content=CSP_31B" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">credit card</a> to book airfare using points. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">All this to say: We just learned about a <a href="https://www.wisebread.com/compare/sapphire-travel?utm_medium=native&utm_source=newsletter&utm_term=morningbrew&adgroup=0224&utm_campaign=CSP-31&utm_content=CSP_31B" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">credit card </a>that offers <strong style="color:#000">2X points on travel and dining</strong>, plus some other amazing benefits that sent my neck pillow straight to the dry cleaner:<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><strong style="color:#000">60,000 welcome points (discover value number in our article—it's awesome)</strong></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>1X points on all other purchases</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><span>One of the largest multipliers on all points for travel cards</span></span></li>

</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We have over a dozen tabs open in our browser comparing flight routes right now; we’re not even worried about the six time-off requests we already sent the boss (we’re leaving whether you approve them or not, Creative Director Blake).  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So if you, like us, would like to stop missing flights, <a href="https://www.wisebread.com/compare/sapphire-travel?utm_medium=native&utm_source=newsletter&utm_term=morningbrew&adgroup=0224&utm_campaign=CSP-31&utm_content=CSP_31B" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this credit card</a> is your ticket outta town.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you could break your gaze with Baby Yoda’s chinchilla eyes at the <a href="https://nypost.com/2020/02/22/baby-yoda-busting-out-at-toy-fair-new-york/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">117th annual Toy Fair New York</a>, you’d notice Brew toy industry correspondent Jamie Wilde playing with toys and pretending to work. This weekend, she trekked to a galaxy far, far away (the Javits Center) to check out 2020’s top toy trends:</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Sustainable toys: </strong></span><span>Lego is launching toys whose packaging is part of the play experience, Mattel is making Mega Bloks with sugarcane-based plastic, and MGA Entertainment unveiled biodegradable L.O.L. Surprise! unboxing kits.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> Mindfulness: </strong></span><span>ASMR was everywhere again this year, but some brands went beyond oddly satisfying slime. Mattel teamed up with mindfulness app Headspace for a line of Barbies promoting self-care. And Spin Master added to its Kinetic Sand line with a squeezable sand product meant for your work desk.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Mixed reality: </strong></span><span><span>Toymakers are continuing to blur the lines between the physical and virtual worlds. Two examples are Lego’s augmented reality-supported Hidden Side kits and Mattel’s </span></span><span><em>Minecraft</em></span><span><span> figures, which can unlock sounds and special effects in the game’s app.</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ol>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/23/week-ahead-february-24?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">

</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week is one long brainstorm to figure out something crazy to do on Saturday, the first February 29 we've had in four years. As Liz Lemon's boyfriend reminds us, "<span>Nothing that happens on Leap Day counts. Real life is for March.”</span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Monday: </strong>2020 NFL Combine begins</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tuesday: </strong>Mardi Gras; consumer confidence; Democratic presidential debate in South Carolina; earnings (Home Depot, Macy’s, Salesforce, Virgin Galactic, SmileDirectClub, The RealReal)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>Ash Wednesday; new home sales; Conservative Political Action Conference begins; earnings (Lowe’s, L Brands, Square, Booking Holdings, Marriott, Etsy)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>Durable goods; second reading of Q4 GDP; earnings (Best Buy, J.C. Penney, Beyond Meat)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>Personal income and outlays; National Girl Scout Cookie Weekend begins; earnings (Wayfair)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Saturday</strong><strong style="color:#000">:</strong> Leap Day</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For Random Acts of Kindness Week </strong>we asked you to share a recent moment when a stranger made your day a little bit brighter. Here are a few of those stories:<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“At the grocery store, the clerk checking me out said 'Wow look outside you two.' I nervously looked outside with the fear of seeing something bad or gross. The clerk then said “isn’t it wonderful that it’s 5:30pm and the sun is still out?” This random act reminded me of appreciating the small things much more. We thanked her by giving her a hug!”—Rodrigo </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><span>“In the restroom at my church I found a small envelope on the counter at the sink. It said, “If you find this, then it was meant for you...etc.” I hesitated but opened it and $10 was inside. I took it the next day to my local Starbucks and asked the barista to use the money to pay for someone after me. An hour later, the barista approached me (I was chatting with friends) and she said that small act created a long string of the same.”—Cyndee</span></span></li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

morning. \u003c/strong\u003eA few fun notes from the world of hockey to kick off your week…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eToday is the 40th anniversary of USA hockey winning the gold medal at the 1980 Olympics in Lake Placid. People forget that the team still had to play another game after the “Miracle on Ice” vs. the USSR.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOn Saturday, Alex Ovechkin became the eighth player in NHL history to score 700 career goals.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAlso on Saturday, 42-year-old Zamboni driver David Ayres was called into action as the emergency goalie for the Carolina Hurricanes. He stopped eight out of 10 shots, earning the win and a $500 paycheck.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END HEADER --\u003e\n\u003c!-- MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c7\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6\" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd class=\"pcard pcard370\" style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nMARKETS: YEAR-TO-DATE\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd class=\"pad5m\"\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c!-- Missing --\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd class=\"pads10 pads6m lastline\" style=\"border-bottom:1px solid #e6e6e6;padding-bottom:0;text-align: center; style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nINVESTING\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nBuffett’s Letter Shows We All Have Those Days\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A photo of Warren Buffett\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTgyNDgwNTMwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\"\u003ca href=\"https://www.flickr.com/photos/140989741@N04/25812934256/\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWarren Buffett\u003c/a\u003e\" (\u003ca href=\"https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ePublic Domain\u003c/a\u003e) by \u003ca href=\"https://www.flickr.com/people/140989741@N04/\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efreeimage4life\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWarren Buffett’s annual shareholder letters are known for their “folksy” wisdom and one-liners. But \u003ca href=\"https://www.berkshirehathaway.com/letters/2019ltr.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe one\u003c/a\u003e he released Saturday was more \u003cem\u003eNightly News\u003c/em\u003e than \u003cem\u003eThe \u003c/em\u003e\u003cem\u003eDaily Show\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMaybe that’s because there isn’t much for Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway to smile about. The sprawling conglomerate’s operating income dipped to $4.4 billion in Q4, a \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-berkshire-results/rising-stocks-fuel-record-profit-for-buffetts-berkshire-operating-profit-disappoints-idUSKCN20G0JE?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e23% drop\u003c/a\u003e from a year ago. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThat number does \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003enot \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003etake into account Berkshire’s investments in stocks, but Buffett has said it’s a better measure of his company’s performance.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBerkshire Hathaway partially or wholly owns companies across many industries, from Geico in insurance to BNSF Railway. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThose holdings have been lucrative for the company, but now it has $128 billion in cash and can’t seem to find an effective way to spend it. “The opportunities to make major acquisitions possessing our required attributes are rare,” Buffett wrote. So instead he spent a record $2.2 billion on stock buybacks during the quarter.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOverall, Berkshire’s stock gained 11% in 2019, while the S\u0026P returned 31.5%, including dividends. It’s Berkshire’s worst \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/berkshire-hathaway-posts-29-2-billion-in-quarterly-earnings-11582379630?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estock market underperformance\u003c/a\u003e in 10 years.   \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFine, there were some good quotes\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOn mergers: \u003c/strong\u003e“I’ve concluded that acquisitions are similar to marriage...sometimes, wonderfully, the new union delivers bliss beyond either party’s hopes. In other cases, disillusionment is swift.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOn sticking to things you’re good at: \u003c/strong\u003e“If I were ever scheduled to appear on \u003cem\u003eDancing With the Stars\u003c/em\u003e, I would immediately seek refuge in the Witness Protection Program. We are all duds at one thing or another.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOn succession: \u003c/strong\u003e“Berkshire shareholders need not worry: Your company is 100% prepared for our departure,” Buffett wrote about himself and his 96-year-old deputy Charlie Munger. Buffett, 89, plans to give \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-02-22/buffett-nods-to-succession-by-giving-jain-abel-a-bigger-voice?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore face time\u003c/a\u003e to Ajit Jain and Greg Abel, the two lieutenants most likely to succeed him at the top of Berkshire. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt might be time to make 2020 the year of WFH. As of yesterday, there were almost 79,000 confirmed coronavirus cases and nearly 2,500 deaths. As infection rates spike in countries like Italy and South Korea, businesses are bracing for deeper impacts.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTourism: \u003c/strong\u003eItaly \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/02/23/europe/italy-novel-coronavirus-spike-intl/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshut down public events\u003c/a\u003e in 10 cities as its caseload spiked above 130 Sunday morning—the largest outbreak outside Asia. Authorities even canceled Venice's popular Carnival festivities.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFrance is experiencing a 30%–40% \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/23/coronavirus-impact-france-sees-tourism-numbers-fall-by-30percent-to-40percent.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edrop in tourists\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since the outbreak, its finance minister said. Almost 8% of its GDP comes from tourism, and around 2.7 million Chinese tourists visit annually. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePharma: \u003c/strong\u003eChina is a major supplier of ingredients for medicines. If the outbreak worsens and production levels don’t return to normal, ~150 prescription drugs \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/coronavirus-threatens-drug-shortage-318c9e7b-5d92-4a5e-b992-2478023c6d01.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecould face shortages\u003c/a\u003e, Axios reports.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTransportation: \u003c/strong\u003eAirlines have \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/02/21/coronavirus-flight-cancellations-top-200000-sending-jet-fuel-lower.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epulled 200,000+ flights\u003c/a\u003e. The disruptions will likely cause the first dip in global air travel demand since 2009. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne subset of aviation is doing just fine, though. The number of business jet flights between Hong Kong to Australia and North America \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/7f22ce92-54c6-11ea-90ad-25e377c0ee1f?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurged 214% in January\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTired:\u003c/strong\u003e Wooing with chocolate and flowers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday, Indian PM Narendra Modi \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/aa3d9fad64b1127b730566830e302be0?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis hosting President Trump\u003c/a\u003e for “Namaste Trump,” a titanic-sized rally that will showcase their chummy relationship. Trump said Modi told him 10 million people would show up along the route to the event venue. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFor Modi, the rally flexes his status on the world stage and distracts from ongoing controversies (like a new citizenship law). For Trump, it’s part of a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/02/23/trump-modi-india-rally-116463?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epitch to Indian-American voters\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, 80%+ of which voted for Hillary Clinton in 2016. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eIndia might’ve edged out the U.K. as the world’s fifth-largest economy last year, but it’s facing its worst slowdown in a decade. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt the same time, it’s stuck in an 18-month trade rut with the U.S. Trump and Modi have \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/cda7fb4ebba1432ba824d2dfbd41fc17?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emoved\u003c/a\u003e their respective countries to more protectionist policies, complicating negotiations, but Trump is keen on opening up India’s vast consumer market (pop. 1.3 billion) to American dairy, whiskey, and pharmaceutical companies. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong We thanked her by giving her a hug!”—Rodrigo \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“In the restroom at my church I found a small envelope on the counter at the sink. I took it the next day to my local Starbucks and asked the barista to use the money to pay for someone after me. An hour later, the barista approached me (I was chatting with friends) and she said that small act created a long string of the
